name: Ferveret
headline: Liquid cooling solutions inspired by nuclear power plant cooling.
description:
Ferveret develops liquid cooling solutions inspired by nuclear power plant cooling. We save data centers 96% in cooling costs, 68% on capital costs, and reduce their carbon footprint by 40% while increasing chip performance by 2X. Today, about 40% of the electricity used in these facilities is wasted on cooling. 

Our technology eliminates this wasted energy.

founders.name: Reza Azizian, Founder
founders.description: Reza is the co-founder and CEO of Ferveret. He is an MIT alumnus and has more than 10 years of experience in the electronic cooling industry. This includes designing a thermal solution for Microsoft HoloLens, as well as working as a senior packaging thermal engineer at NVIDIA and senior design thermal engineer at Cruise.

founders.name: Matteo Bucci, Founder
founders.description: Matteo is the co-founder and CTO of Ferveret as well as a faculty member in Nuclear Science and Engineering at MIT. Prior to Ferveret, he spent nearly a decade as a Research Scientist at CEA Paris. Fields of expertise include heat transfer, fluid dynamics, and nuclear reactor design. Outside of his core work, Matteo is also a nuclear energy consultant and editor of Applied Thermal Engineering.

# Liquid cooling
# reimagined
[Download Crypto Product Sheet](http://www.ferveret.com/<#>)
## building the
## Future of Cooling
Data centers today are dirty and expensive. If nothing changes, data centers could consume [up to 9% of U.S. electricity generation by 2030](http://www.ferveret.com/<https:/www.epri.com/about/media-resources/press-release/q5vU86fr8TKxATfX8IHf1U48Vw4r1DZF#:~:text=According%20to%20a%20new%20study,supply%20challenges%2C%20among%20other%20issues>). Roughly [40% of emissions from data centers](http://www.ferveret.com/<https:/www.nature.com/articles/d41586-018-06610-y>) will be due to inefficient cooling, which is incredibly expensive for companies. Our technology eliminates this waste of money and the associated emissions.
### Data generated is only increasing
Graph showcases data generated in zettabytes. A single zettabyte is over 1 billion terabytes.‍Sources via [Science Daily](http://www.ferveret.com/<https:/www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2013/05/130522085217.htm>) and [HDFS](http://www.ferveret.com/<https:/www.hdfstutorial.com/blog/big-data-use-cases-in-banking-and-financial-services/>).
## Data generated
## is increasing
Projected growth of data generated in zettabytes. A single zettabyte is 1 billion terabytes.Sources via [Science Daily](http://www.ferveret.com/<https:/www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2013/05/130522085217.htm>) and [HDFS](http://www.ferveret.com/<https:/www.hdfstutorial.com/blog/big-data-use-cases-in-banking-and-financial-services/>).
### Carbon emissions will follow
Projected total worldwide emissions of data centers. This correlation between data and carbon emissions is evident and growing.‍Sources via [Computer World](http://www.ferveret.com/<https:/www.computerworld.com/article/3431148/why-data-centres-are-the-new-frontier-in-the-fight-against-climate-change.html>) and [The Guardian](http://www.ferveret.com/<https:/www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/dec/11/tsunami-of-data-could-consume-fifth-global-electricity-by-2025>).
## Carbon emissions
## will follow
Projected total worldwide emissions of data centers. This correlation between data and carbon emissions is evident and growing.‍Sources via [Computer World](http://www.ferveret.com/<https:/www.computerworld.com/article/3431148/why-data-centres-are-the-new-frontier-in-the-fight-against-climate-change.html>) and [The Guardian](http://www.ferveret.com/<https:/www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/dec/11/tsunami-of-data-could-consume-fifth-global-electricity-by-2025>).
Our Solution
### Different applicationsSame incredible efficiency
# 96%
Less energy wasted
# 40%
Smaller footprint
# **~2X**
CPU & GPU performance
Technology enabled by subcooled boiling
Ferveret uses subcooled boiling which allows for exceptionally high heat fluxes to be removed from processors and other heat generating components.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af68cf67bbedd53a7b6906_Photo%201.jpg)![A mechanical arm reaching outward](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63cdf599736e6836edbb0b2b_Photo%204.jpg)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af68f8917c0c5db04d7b9f_Photo%202.jpg)![Illuminating car lights on the highway](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af691bea6dbc75dcd1d2ec_Photo%203.jpg)
## Data Centers
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af68cf67bbedd53a7b6906_Photo%201.jpg)
The demand for efficient machines and infrastructure is more important than ever. Electricity usage in particular is overbearing with current air and once-through water cooling machines.
[See Data Center Solution](http://www.ferveret.com/</data-center>)
## Artificial Intelligence
![A mechanical arm reaching outward](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63cdf599736e6836edbb0b2b_Photo%204.jpg)
With the rise of AI applications and platforms like ChatGPT, increased computation power is critical. Ferveret makes that a possibility with its cooling technology.
[See AI Solution](http://www.ferveret.com/</data-center>)
## Crypto Mining
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af68f8917c0c5db04d7b9f_Photo%202.jpg)
Ferveret takes full advantage of chip performance by overclocking miners, reducing noise pollution, electricity consumption, and the physical footprint of mining facilities.
[See Crypto Solution](http://www.ferveret.com/</crypto>)
## Autonomous Vehicles
![Illuminating car lights on the highway](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af691bea6dbc75dcd1d2ec_Photo%203.jpg)
Today, the average automobile has between 1,000 and 3,000 chips inside it. We are addressing problems associated with battery cooling and sensors to enable self-driving capabilities.
## Executive Team
### Dr. Azizian completed his post-doctoral research and a portion of his Ph.D. at MIT. He has over 10 years of experience in the cooling industry. Before starting Ferveret, he designed a thermal solution for the Microsoft HoloLens, and also worked as a Senior Thermal Engineer at NVIDIA and Cruise.
# Dr. Reza Azizian
# Co-Founder & CEO
## Dr. Bucci is a faculty member at MIT and previously worked as a Research Scientist at CEA Paris for nearly a decade. Outside of his core work, he is also a nuclear energy consultant and editor of Applied Thermal Engineering.
# Dr. Matteo Bucci
# Co-Founder & CTO
## Andrea is a B2B executive with over two decades of experience. He has held leadership positions in Dell Technologies, Genesys, EMC, and led consulting engagements with McKinsey & Co; earlier in his career he was in the technical team of two startups. He is a graduate of the Chicago Booth School of Business (MBA) and Scuola Sant'Anna di Pisa (MSEE, BSEE).
# Andrea Marini
# Chief Revenue Officer (CRO)
Our Investors
![Y Combinator](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af270110dd573a561c9a71_Y%20Combinator%20\(Adjusted\).png)![MIT E14 Fund](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af270110dd579f021c9a75_E14%20\(Adjusted\).png)![Climate Capital](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af270110dd57d3031c9a69_Climate%20Capital%20\(Adjusted\).png)![Cathexis Ventures](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af270110dd572a951c9a61_Cathexis%20Ventures%20\(Adjusted\).png)![Verso Capital](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/642b0e8a421028a1a6039f4d_Verso%20Logo.png)![Valkyrie Fund](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af270110dd574f5b1c9a65_Valkyrie%20\(Adjusted\).png)![Y Combinator](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af270110dd573a561c9a71_Y%20Combinator%20\(Adjusted\).png)![MIT E14 Fund](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af270110dd579f021c9a75_E14%20\(Adjusted\).png)![Climate Capital](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af270110dd57d3031c9a69_Climate%20Capital%20\(Adjusted\).png)![Cathexis Ventures](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af270110dd572a951c9a61_Cathexis%20Ventures%20\(Adjusted\).png)![Verso Capital](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/642b0e8a421028a1a6039f4d_Verso%20Logo.png)![Valkyrie Fund](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/63ade9106c21e676b3d24323/63af270110dd574f5b1c9a65_Valkyrie%20\(Adjusted\).png)

generated_description:
### Ferveret: Redefining Liquid Cooling Solutions

Founded in 2021 and hailing from the heart of Silicon Valley, San Jose, California, Ferveret is making waves in the tech landscape with its innovative liquid cooling solutions influenced by nuclear power plant technology. This startup emerged from the Y Combinator Batch S21, and its mission is crystal clear: to revolutionize how data centers cool their systems, reducing both environmental impact and operational costs.

#### The Problem with Current Cooling Systems

Did you know that around 40% of the electricity consumed by data centers is wasted on cooling? That’s a staggering statistic! As data generation skyrockets—projected to reach dizzying heights—so too does the electricity consumption of these facilities, which could account for 9% of U.S. electricity generation by 2030. Add to that the fact that inefficient cooling contributes roughly 40% of emissions from data centers, and it’s clear that a solution is needed.

#### Innovative Technology and Impressive Savings

Ferveret tackles this problem head-on with its cutting-edge technology that not only eliminates waste but also enhances chip performance. Their solutions claim to save data centers an impressive **96% in cooling costs**, **68% on capital expenditures**, and **reduce carbon footprints by 40%**, all while doubling the performance of CPUs and GPUs. They achieve this through a process known as subcooled boiling, which allows for remarkably efficient heat removal from processors and other high-heat components.

#### A Focus on Diverse Industries

Ferveret's applications are broad, touching sectors like:

- **Data Centers:** Combat inefficient cooling strategies that are both costly and environmentally damaging.
- **Artificial Intelligence:** Support the computational demands of AI applications, ensuring systems run cooler and more efficiently.
- **Crypto Mining:** Enhance performance through overclocking techniques, reducing noise and energy expenditures in crypto facilities.
- **Autonomous Vehicles:** Address the substantial cooling needs of sensor and battery technology.

#### Meet the Team

Behind this ambitious project is a diverse team of six leading experts. Co-founders Dr. Reza Azizian and Dr. Matteo Bucci bring rich backgrounds from MIT and the cooling industry, while Andrea Marini, the Chief Revenue Officer, has extensive experience with companies like Dell Technologies and Genesys. This combination of technical prowess and business acumen positions Ferveret as a formidable player in the industry.

#### Investors and Future Vision

Ferveret is backed by notable investors, including Y Combinator, MIT E14 Fund, and Climate Capital, indicating strong confidence in its potential. As the startup prepares to scale its operations, it’s focused not just on profitability, but on making a significant positive impact in the climate space.

#### Conclusion

Ferveret is not just another tech startup; it’s a bold step toward a more efficient and sustainable future for data centers, leveraging the lessons learned from nuclear cooling systems. As the demand for advanced computing grows, so does the opportunity for Ferveret to lead the charge in cooling innovation. 

For more information, visit [Ferveret's website](http://www.ferveret.com).
